name: 黃如瑩
objective: The first goal of this course is to engage students in the understanding and discussions on the current economic and trading issues on both global and regional scales. The second goal is to cultivate students’ full English skills, including listening, reading, speaking, writing, and interpreting/translating while exploring aforementioned global and regional economic/trading affairs.

II. Syllabus
Week One: Introduction
.
Theme One: Extreme weather conditions and world economy
Week Two
Draught, wildfires, flooding, and their economical impacts
Week Three
New inventions to tackle the problem of lack of drinking water
"How to capture water from the air”
Week Four
New inventions to cope with climate change
 "Artificial Milk" to reduce global warming
"Floating Farm" to cope with rising sea levels
.
Theme Two: Cultural/political conflicts and world economy
Week Five  
Russia/Ukraine war and its impacts on world and regional economy
Week Six 
International sanctions on Russia and the need for Russia’s energy supply
Week Seven
Regional conflicts in Asia and the possible  impacts
Week Eight
Global demand for advanced computer chips 
Week Nine: Midterm exam week
Week Ten 
The disruption of world trade routes 
.
Theme Three: Covid-19 pandemic and world health issues
Week Eleven
The impact of Covid-19 pandemic on the poor
Week Twelve
How does different business cash in on the Covid-19 pandemic?
Week Thirteen
How does Covid-19 pandemic change the ways business are conducted?
Week Fourteen 
The impact of new Covid-19 variants and monkeypox
Week Fifteen 
How does health industry become so prosperous?
"How to Boost Your Immune System"
.
Week Sixteen: Final exam 1/3
(6 min reports) x 13
Week Seventeen: Final exam 2/3
( 6-min reports) x 13 students
Week Eighteen: Final exam 3/3
( 6-min reports) x 13 students
